solution_line_template: Jacob can eat {nellie_candies} / {jacob_divisor} = <<{nellie_candies}/{jacob_divisor}={jacob_candies}>>{jacob_candies} candies before crying.
Lana can eat {jacob_candies} - {lana_deduction} = <<{jacob_candies}-{lana_deduction}={lana_candies}>>{lana_candies} candies before crying.

Nellie, Jacob, and Lana all ate until they cried, so they ate {nellie_candies} + {jacob_candies} + {lana_candies} = <<{nellie_candies}+{jacob_candies}+{lana_candies}={total_eaten_candies}>>{total_eaten_candies} candies.
Thus, there are {initial_candies} - {total_eaten_candies} = <<{initial_candies}-{total_eaten_candies}={remaining_candies}>>{remaining_candies} candies left in the bucket.

After dividing the remaining candies equally, they will each get {remaining_candies} / {number_of_people} = <<{remaining_candies}/{number_of_people}={candies_per_person}>>{candies_per_person} sourball candies.
